What does 'Par 67' mean? DeChambeau calling Augusta National a Par 67, which is five less strokes than what Augusta is, was seen as disrespectful to many. In a way, it sounded like DeChambeau was saying that he thought the course was easier than it seemed or how other golfers played it. Some of the best golfers in the world have described it as quite difficult. He missed the cut in 2022 and 2023, and was outside of the top-20 in 2016, 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021.
